text: William Steele Sessions (May 27, 1930 - June 12, 2020) an American politician and lawyer."Sessions" , freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com. He served as a federal judge and Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation from 1987 through 1993 after being nominated by President Ronald Reagan. He served as FBI director until he was fired by President Bill Clinton. Sessions was appointed by President Reagan as a Commissioner of the Martin Luther King, Jr., Federal Holiday Commission, and was a Delegate for the Americas to the Executive Committee of ICPO-Interpol. He was also a member of the Constitution Project's bipartisan Liberty and Security Committee. Sessions died on June 12, 2020, in San Antonio, Texas from heart failure-related problems at the age of 90. ==References== ==Other websites== * William Sessions quotes * Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American judges Category:Directors of the Federal Bureau of Investigation Category:Politicians from Arkansas Category:Politicians from San Antonio, Texas Category:Lawyers from San Antonio Category:Lawyers from Arkansas Category:People from Fort Smith, Arkansas
title: William S. Sessions
